content:
I'm happy to help! With so many events to attend, it can be challenging to keep track of your expenses. A good budgeting app can make a huge difference in helping you stay on top of your finances. Here are some popular budgeting apps that can categorize your spending:

1. **Mint**: A highly-rated app that connects to your bank accounts, tracks your spending, and categorizes your expenses. It also offers bill tracking, credit score monitoring, and investment tracking. (Free, iOS and Android)
2. **Personal Capital**: A comprehensive app that helps you track your income and expenses, investments, and debts. It also offers financial planning tools and investment tracking. (Free, iOS and Android)
3. **You Need a Budget (YNAB)**: A budgeting app that helps you manage your finances by assigning jobs to every dollar you earn. It offers features like automated savings, investment tracking, and bill tracking. (Free trial, then $6.99/month or $83.99/year, iOS and Android)
4. **Spendee**: A user-friendly app that allows you to track your expenses by categorizing them into different groups. It also offers features like automated expense tracking, budgeting, and receipt scanning. (Free, iOS and Android)
5. **Wally**: A budgeting app that connects to your bank accounts and credit cards, tracks your expenses, and categorizes them into different groups. It also offers features like bill tracking and investment tracking. (Free, iOS and Android)
6. **Pocketbook**: A budgeting app that allows you to track your income and expenses, set budgets, and receive alerts when you go over budget. It also offers features like investment tracking and bill tracking. (Free, iOS and Android)
7. **Quicken**: A personal finance app that helps you track your spending, creates a budget, and sets financial goals. It also offers features like investment tracking and bill tracking. (Free trial, then $39.99/year, iOS and Android)

Before choosing an app, consider the following factors:

1. **Ease of use**: Choose an app that's easy to navigate and understand.
2. **Features**: Consider the features you need, such as investment tracking, bill tracking, or credit score monitoring.
3. **Connectivity**: Ensure the app can connect to your bank accounts and credit cards.
4. **Security**: Look for apps with strong security measures, such as encryption and two-factor authentication.
5. **Cost**: Some apps are free, while others require a subscription or one-time payment.

Take some time to explore these options, and I'm sure you'll find an app that fits your needs and helps you stay on top of your expenses!
